sen.j: 松平 定直（まつだいら さだなお、万治3年1月19日 (旧暦)（1660年2月29日） - 享保5年10月25日 (旧暦)（1720年11月24日））は江戸時代の大名。
sen.e: Sadanao MATSUDAIRA (February 29, 1660 - November 24, 1720) was a daimyo in the Edo period.
Sadanao MATSUDAIRA (February 29, 1660 - November 24, 1720) was a daimyo in the Edo period.
Sadanao MATSUDAIRA (February 29, 1660 - November 24, 1720) was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Edo period.

sen.j: 伊予松山藩4代藩主。
sen.e: He was the fourth lord of the Iyo-Matsuyama Domain.
He was the fourth lord of the Iyo-Matsuyama Domain.
He was the fourth lord of the Matsuyama Domain in Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 伊予松山藩の表記変更

sen.j: 定勝系久松松平家宗家5代。
sen.e: He was the fifth head of the Hiasamatsu Matsudaira family of Sadakatsu lineage.
He was the fifth head of the Hiasamatsu Matsudaira family of the Sadakatsu lineage.
He was the fifth head of the Hiasamatsu Matsudaira family of the Sadakatsu lineage.

sen.j: 伊予今治藩2代藩主松平定時の長男。
sen.e: He was the first son of Sadatoki MATSUDAIRA, the second lord of the Iyo-Imabari Domain.
He was the first son of Sadatoki MATSUDAIRA, the second lord of the Iyo-Imabari Domain.
He was the first son of Sadatoki MATSUDAIRA, the second lord of the Imabari Domain in Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 伊予今治藩の表記変更

sen.j: 実母は側室嶺頂院殿（平岡氏の娘）。
sen.e: His birth mother was Reichoinden, Concubine (the daughter of the Hiraoka clan).
His birth mother was the noble's concubine Reichoinden (of the Hiraoka clan).
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency and to reflect source text.
sen.e: His biological mother was the noble's concubine Reichoinden (of the Hiraoka clan).

sen.j: 正室は稲葉正往の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Masayuki INABA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Masayuki INABA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Masayuki INABA.

sen.j: 子に松平定仲（長男）、松平定英（三男）、松平定章（四男）。
sen.e: His children included Sadanaka MATSUDAIRA (the first son), Sadahide MATSUDAIRA (the third son) and Sadaakira MATSUDAIRA (the fourth son).
His children included Sadanaka MATSUDAIRA (first son), Sadahide MATSUDAIRA (third son) and Sadaakira MATSUDAIRA (fourth son).
His children included Sadanaka MATSUDAIRA (first son), Sadahide MATSUDAIRA (third son) and Sadaakira MATSUDAIRA (fourth son).

sen.j: 官位官職は従四位下、隠岐守、侍従。
sen.e: His official rank and government post was Jushiinoge Oki no kami jiju (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade of the governor of Oki Province, Chamberlain).
His official rank and government post was Jushiinoge Oki no kami jiju (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade of the governor of Oki Province, Chamberlain).
His official rank and government posts were Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Oki no kami (governor of Oki Province), and jiju (chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 説明をそれぞれ分けました。post was→posts were

sen.j: 幼名は鍋之助。
sen.e: His childhood name was Nabenosuke.
His childhood name was Nabenosuke.
His childhood name was Nabenosuke.

sen.j: 万治3年（1660年）誕生。
sen.e: He was born in 1660.
Sadanao MATSUDAIRA was born in 1660.
Sadanao MATSUDAIRA was born in 1660.

sen.j: 延宝2年（1674年）、松山藩主松平定長の養嗣子となり、同年、松山藩藩主に就任。
sen.e: In 1674, he became the heir adopted by Sadanaga MATSUDAIRA, the lord of Matsuyama Domain and became the lord of Matsuyama Domain.
In 1674, he became the adoptive heir of Sadanaga MATSUDAIRA, the lord of the Matsuyama Domain and went on to succeed him as lord of the Matsuyama Domain.
In 1674, he became the adoptive heir of Sadanaga MATSUDAIRA, the lord of the Matsuyama Domain and went on to succeed him as lord of the Matsuyama Domain.

sen.j: 養母は春光院殿京極氏の女。
sen.e: His adopted mother was the daughter of Shunkoinden Kyogoku clan.
sen.cmt: 春光院殿京極氏→ Shunkoinden Kyogoku clan
sen.e: His adoptive mother was of the Shunkoinden Kyogoku clan.
His adoptive mother was of the Shunkoinden Kyogoku clan.

sen.j: この年に従五位下淡路守に任じられ、その3年後には隠岐守に転じ、従四位下に昇る。
sen.e: In that year, he was appointed to Jugoinoge Awaji no kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade of the governor of Awaji Province) and three years later, he became the governor of Oki Province and was promoted to the Lower Junior Fourth Rank.

In that year, he was appointed to Jugoinoge Awaji no kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade of the governor of Awaji Province) and three years later, he became the governor of Oki Province and was promoted to the Lower Junior Fourth Rank.

In that year, he was appointed to Jugoinoge Awaji no kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade of the governor of Awaji Province) and three years later, he became the governor of Oki Province and was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank., Lower Grade).

sen.j: 貞享4年（1687年）、藩庁を二ノ丸より三ノ丸に移し、二ノ丸を藩庁別棟（隠居所）とする。
sen.e: In 1687, he moved the government building of the domain from Ninomaru to Sannomaru and used Ninomaru as a separate government building of the domain (a retreat for his old age).
In 1687, he moved the hancho (domain administration building) from Ninomaru to Sannomaru and used Ninomaru as a separate hancho (a retreat for his old age).
In 1687, he moved the hancho (domain administration building) from Ninomaru to Sannomaru and used Ninomaru as a separate hancho (a retreat for his old age).

sen.j: 宝永元年（1704年）、徳川将軍家世嗣徳川家宣の官位昇進のため、京都御使を命ぜられ侍従に昇進する。
sen.e: In 1704, with the promotion in official rank of Ienobu TOKUGAWA, the successor of the Tokugawa Shogun family, he was assigned to the Shogunate messenger to Kyoto and promoted to jiju.
In 1704, with the promotion in official rank of Ienobu TOKUGAWA, the successor of the Tokugawa Shogun family, Sadanao was appointed Shogunate messenger to Kyoto and promoted to jiju (chamberlain).
In 1704, with the promotion in official rank of Ienobu TOKUGAWA, the successor of the Tokugawa Shogun family, Sadanao was appointed Shogunate messenger to Kyoto and promoted to jiju.

sen.j: 京都では東山天皇の拝謁を賜う。
sen.e: In Kyoto, he had an audience with the Emperor Higashiyama.
In Kyoto, he had an audience with the Emperor Higashiyama.
In Kyoto, he had an audience with the Emperor Higashiyama.

sen.j: 翌年、領内では財政難から初めて藩札を発行。
sen.e: The following year, a han bill (bills usable only in a particular feudal clan) was issued for the first time in the territory because of financial difficulties.
In the following year, hansatsu (currency issued by a feudal domain) were issued for the first time in the territory because of financial difficulties.
In the following year, hansatsu (currency issued by a feudal domain) were issued for the first time in the territory because of financial difficulties.

sen.j: その一方で、地坪制度を導入することによって農民負担の均質化をはかり、課税法を検見法から定免法に改めることによって、安定した年貢収入に成功する。
sen.e: On the other hand, he homogenized peasants' burden through the introduction of the land area system and succeeded in earning stable revenues from nengu (land tax) by revising the taxation method from kemi-ho (annual crop inspections) to jomen-ho (a fixed tax rate).

On the other hand, he homogenized farmer's burden through the introduction of the land area system and succeeded in earning stable revenues from nengu (land taxes) by revising the taxation method from kemi-ho (annual crop inspections) to jomen-ho (a fixed tax rate).

On the other hand, he homogenized farmer's burden through the introduction of the land area system and succeeded in earning stable revenues from nengu (land taxes) by revising the taxation method from kemi-ho (annual crop inspections) to jomen-ho (a fixed tax rate).

sen.j: 文化面では、俳諧にたしなみ、その興隆に貢献した。
sen.e: On the cultural front, he was fond of Haikai (seventeen-syllable verse) and contributed to its prosperity.
On the cultural front, he was fond of Haikai (seventeen-syllable verse) and contributed to its prosperity.
On the cultural front, he was fond of Haikai (seventeen-syllable verse) and contributed to its prosperity.

sen.j: 元禄15年（1702年）12月15日に発生した元禄赤穂事件に関して、定直は赤穂浪士47名のうち大石主税・堀部安兵衛・木村岡右衛門・中村勘助・菅谷半之丞・千馬三郎兵衛・不破数右衛門・大高源五・貝賀弥左衛門・岡野金右衛門の10名の預かりを命じられた。
sen.e: In connection with the Genroku Ako Incident on December 15, 1702, Sadanao was ordered to take custody of ten Ako Roshi (lordless samurai of Ako domain); Chikara OISHI, Yasube HORIBE, Okaemon KIMURA, Kansuke NAKAMURA, Hannojo SUGAYA, Saburobe CHIBA, Kazuemon FUWA, Gengo OTAKA, Yazaemon KAIGA and Kinemon OKANO, out of total 47 persons.

In connection with the Genroku Ako Incident on December 15, 1702, Sadanao was ordered to take custody of ten Ako roshi (lordless samurai of Ako domain); Chikara OISHI, Yasube HORIBE, Okaemon KIMURA, Kansuke NAKAMURA, Hannojo SUGAYA, Saburobe CHIBA, Kazuemon FUWA, Gengo OTAKA, Yazaemon KAIGA and Kinemon OKANO, out of total 47 persons.

In connection with the Genroku Ako Incident on December 15, 1702, Sadanao was ordered to take custody of 10 Ako roshi (lordless samurai of Ako domain); Chikara OISHI, Yasube HORIBE, Okaemon KIMURA, Kansuke NAKAMURA, Hannojo SUGAYA, Saburobe CHIBA, Kazuemon FUWA, Gengo OTAKA, Yazaemon KAIGA and Kinemon OKANO, out of total 47 persons.

sen.j: この頃、病床にあった定直は、江戸城への登城ができず、家臣を通じてこの命令を受けた。
sen.e: At that time, Sadanao, who was ill in bed, was unable to go to the Edo-jo Castle and received this order through his vassal.
At that time, Sadanao, who was ill in bed, was unable to go to Edo-jo Castle and received this order through his vassal.
At that time, Sadanao, who was ill in bed, was unable to go to Edo-jo Castle and received this order through his vassal.

sen.j: 元禄16年（1703年）1月5日になって浪士達と会見し、定直は以下のように述べている。
sen.e: As late as January 5, 1703, he met the Roshi and said as follows.
sen.cmt: 「以下のように述べている」を追加し、原文の切れ目を調整して訳文を合わせました。
sen.e: He met the roshi in January 5, 1703 and said the following:
He met the roshi in January 5, 1703 and said the following:

sen.j: ｢自分は前年の冬より貴方達に対面したいと思っていたが、病で登城もできない有様で会うことができなかった。」
sen.e: I have longed to meet you since last year, but I was unable to meet you because I couldn't even go to the castle due to my illness.'
sen.cmt: 原文の切れ目を調整して訳文を合わせました。
sen.e: I have longed to meet you since last year, but was not able to as my illness meant that I was unable to even travel to the castle.'
I have longed to meet you since last year, but was not able to as my illness meant that I was unable to even travel to the castle.'

sen.j: 「だがこのたびの事、自分は心の底から感心している。」
sen.e: But, I'm really impressed by this incidence from the bottom of my heart.'
However, I am deeply impressed by this incident.'
However, I am deeply impressed by this incident.'

sen.j: 「もっと大歓迎をしたいところだが、貴方達は幕府からのお預かり人であるためこれができない。」
sen.e: I would like to give you a bigger welcome, but I can't do so because you are the custody of the shogunate.'
sen.cmt: 幕府からのお預かり人→the custody of the shogunate
sen.e: I would like to give you a bigger welcome, but I cannot do so because you are the custody of the shogunate.'
I would like to give you a bigger welcome, but I cannot do so because you are the custody of the shogunate.'

sen.j: 「しかし諸事不自由はさせない。」
sen.e: But, I will provide you good circumstances in various matters.'
However I will not restrict you with regard to various matters.'
However I will not restrict you with regard to various matters.'

sen.j: 「用事があれば遠慮なく家臣に申し付けてくれてかまわない。｣
sen.e: If you need anything, don't hesitate to ask my vassals.'
sen.cmt: 「と述べている」は上と重複するので削除しました。
sen.e: If you require anything, do not hesitate to ask my vassals.'
If you require anything, do not hesitate to ask my vassals.'

sen.j: 松平家の浪士達への待遇は大石内蔵助らを預かった細川綱利に比べ劣ったようである。
sen.e: It was said that Matsudaira family's treatment to the Roshi was inferior to Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA's, who was given custody of Kuranosuke OISHI, etc. and the family was criticized by samurai and common people of Edo as 'The water Hosokawa (Mizuno) flow to the ocean (Mori, Governor of Kai Province) is clean but offshore (Matsudaira, Governor of Oki Province) water is turbid' (kyoka at that time).
It was said that Matsudaira family's treatment of the roshi was inferior to that of Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA who was given custody of Kuranosuke OISHI and others.
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It was said that Matsudaira family's treatment of the roshi was inferior to that of Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA who was given custody of Kuranosuke OISHI and others.

sen.j: 「細川の 水の（水野）流れは清けれど ただ大海（毛利甲斐守）の 沖（松平隠岐守）ぞ濁れる」（当時の狂歌）と江戸の武士や庶民からは批判された。
sen.e: The family was criticized by the samurai and common people of Edo who would say that 'The flowing water (Mizuno) of Hosokawa is clean but the open water (Matsudaira, Governor of Oki Province) of the ocean (Mori, Governor of Kai Province) is turbid' (a satirical tanka poem of the time).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The family was criticized by the samurai and common people of Edo who would say that 'The flowing water (Mizuno) of Hosokawa is clean but the open water (Matsudaira, Governor of Oki Province) of the ocean (Mori, Governor of Kai Province) is turbid' (a satirical tanka poem of the time).

sen.j: 享保5年（1720年）、江戸松山藩邸三田中屋敷にて卒去。
sen.e: In 1720, he passed away in the 三田中 residence of the Matsuyama Domain in Edo.
sen.cmt: 三田中→読み方不明です。
sen.e: In 1720, he passed away in the 三田中 residence of the Matsuyama Domain in Edo.
In 1720, he passed away in the second residence of the Matsuyama Domain in Mita, Edo.
sen.cmt: 「三田にあった中屋敷」と解釈し、そう訳しました。

sen.j: 享年61。
sen.e: He died at 61.
He died at 61.
He died at 61.

sen.j: 法号は大龍院殿前四位拾遺兼隠州刺史観誉喜広聞証大居士。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist title was 大龍院殿前四位拾遺兼隠州刺史観誉喜広聞証大居士.
sen.cmt: 大龍院殿前四位拾遺兼隠州刺史観誉喜広聞証大居士→読み方不明です。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist title was 大龍院殿前四位拾遺兼隠州刺史観誉喜広聞証大居士.
His posthumous Buddhist title was 大龍院殿前四位拾遺兼隠州刺史観誉喜広聞証大居士.

sen.j: 遺骸は三田済海寺で荼毘に付され、遺骨は松山市大林寺に葬られた。
sen.e: His corpse was cremated in the Mita Saikai-ji Temple and the ashes were buried in the Dairin-ji Temple in Matsuyama City.
His corpse was cremated at Mita Saikai-ji Temple and the ashes were buried at Dairin-ji Temple in Matsuyama City.
His corpse was cremated at Mita Saikai-ji Temple and the ashes were buried at Dairin-ji Temple in Matsuyama City.
